Text saved: Wasfia first saw a hula hoop, which is a plastic ring you spin around your waist, when she was a young girl in Bangladesh. She saw a child from another country playing with it, although people in her country believed girls should not play with hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people who have climbed the Seven Summits, which are the highest mountains on each continent, like Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to spin her hoop on each peak. She did this to help women and girls feel strong and able to play sports, because in her country this is often not allowed.
